Title.evidence: Marker-based roentgen stereophotogrammetric analysis (RSA) is an accurate method for measuring in vivo implant migration, which requires attachment of tantalum markers to the implant.

Objective.evidence: The effect of contour reduction on the accuracy of the model-based method was investigated using three different contour selection schemes on tibial components in 24 patients at 3 and 6 month followup.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The effect of contour reduction on the accuracy of the model-based method was investigated using three different contour selection schemes on tibial components in 24 patients at 3 and 6 month followup.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The agreement interval (mean ± 2 standard deviations), which bounds the differences between the marker-based and model-based methods with contour reduction was smaller than −0.028 ± 0.254 mm.
